channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Why people always think they’re right, according to science
item.description: A new study says it hinges on having the facts.

item.title: Kenya’s Police Battle Haitian Gangs While Understaffed and Lacking Money
item.description: Hundreds of Kenyan police officers are in Port-au-Prince, trying to take the capital back from gangs, but financing and personnel shortages have hampe...

item.title: Biden Accuses Trump of ‘Outright Lies’ About Hurricane Response
item.description: President Biden expressed concern that misinformation would undermine confidence in the response to Hurricane Milton.

item.title: Letitia James vs. Andrew Cuomo for NYC Mayor? It Could Happen.
item.description: With Mayor Eric Adams’s future in doubt, former Gov. Andrew Cuomo and his adversary Letitia James, the state attorney general, could find themselves i...

item.title: The CEO of the Global Black Economic Forum says we’re ‘asking the wrong questions’ when it comes to DEI
item.description: Alphonso David says that leaders should be probing into the corporate world’s systemic inequalities.

item.title: McDonald’s largest french fry maker lays off hundreds as Americans turn away from fries
item.description: Lamb Weston, North America’s biggest french fry producer, counts McDonald’s and Yum Brands among its customers.

item.title: OpenAI says China-linked group tried to phish its employees
item.description: A suspected China-based group posed as a user of ChatGPT and sent customer support emails to staff.

item.title: Displaced Lebanese Seek Shelter on the Streets of Beirut
item.description: Israeli calls for evacuations have sent residents of more than 100 villages and urban areas of southern Lebanon fleeing north, according to the United...

item.title: JetBlue takes away hot meals for everyone but first class
item.description: After years of unprofitability, the budget airline has taken to cutting costs.

item.title: Biden and Netanyahu Speak as Israel Weighs Retaliation Against Iran
item.description: The conversation carried the weight of the worst relationship between the United States and Israel in years.

item.title: Biden and Netanyahu Speak as Israel Weighs Retaliation Against Iran
item.description: The conversation carried the weight of the worst relationship between the United States and Israel in years.

item.title: Deadly Israeli Strike in Northern Gaza
item.description: Footage obtained by Reuters shows a burned-out ambulance and dark smoke rising on the grounds of a hospital in Jabaliya, in northern Gaza.

item.title: An Awkward Dance: Harris Has to Defer to the President She Seeks to Replace
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris has been a loyal understudy to President Biden. But tensions are inevitable as she increasingly takes center stage.

item.title: Meeting of Western Leaders on Ukraine Is Postponed in Setback for Kyiv
item.description: A top-level gathering in Germany intended to show support for Ukraine was put off after President Biden canceled his trip to deal with Hurricane Milto...

item.title: The Trump-Harris Election Is Creating Anxiety on Wall Street
item.description: Among deal makers with fortunes at stake, the consequences of a Harris or a Trump win are increasingly murky.
